original_title: CBA grows into a technological leader in Sri Lanka backed by 55-year legacy
original_body_lines: Ceylon Business Appliances (CBA) celebrates 55 years in Sri Lanka’s technology sector, making a journey from humble beginnings to becoming an innovator in fintech, digital enterprise, and AI-powered solutions.

Founded in 1970 by the late Charles Singhyar, CBA has weathered national challenges, including civil war, economic crises, and natural disasters, by prioritising a culture of integrity and employee loyalty.
“Our focus has never been just on numbers,” said Sardha Fernando, Managing Director. “It’s about standing by our values and our responsibility to society. That defines our growth.”

The company has evolved from servicing banks to pioneering national firsts, including cashless vending solutions, payment systems for over 60,000 merchants, virtual card platforms, and e-ticketing for public transport. Recently, CBA has expanded into EduTech, HealthTech, and is now driving AI technologies to uplift operational efficiencies across industries.
